title: Normalize 'did' and 'did_doc' field names in creq/cresp
non-HIPE: update negotiation diagram to use 'proposal'
Cross-Domain Messaging: Changed format of "msg" field.
body:
Motivation:
Libindy `pack` function in the current implementation builds JSON object and then does a conversion to bytes.
- Setting bytes as is to A2A `msg` field is super inefficient because of the following message JSON serialization.
- Applying additional base64 wrapping increase message size also

Solution: There the next possible options:
- converting the object back from bytes (as I suggested in PR) before setting as a value
- converting bytes to string some simple way
- changing of `pack` function to return JSON string instead of conversion to bytes.

Signed-off-by: artem.ivanov <artem.ivanov@dsr-company.com>

title: propose HIPE: Agent message routing
body:
As discussed in the Agent WG call on Dec 5, this HIPE defines the following 

- New message types for the routing family to maintain routing records.
- Two examples of message delivery featuring routing and maintenance of routing records.

Please pay close attention to some of the un-resolved questions around this implementation as I am not convinced with all aspects.

title: Enable readthedocs support for indy-hipe
body:
First, I recognize that this looks like a large PR, but the changes I've made were pretty simple. 

As discussed in the HIPE [0025-indy-docs-framework](https://github.com/hyperledger/indy-hipe/blob/master/text/0025-indy-docs-framework/README.md) we would like to have a centralized site for our documentation. The changes I have made are outlined in that HIPE. 

I've added the following files:
- `conf.py`  - used to build the documentation with sphinx
- `Makefile` - proves users a way to build and test the sphinx docs locally
- `text/index.rst` - specifies the menu structure for readthedocs

I've changed the following things:
- Changed the `0000-template.md` and all of the current hipes to have only 1 `<h1>` header. This is an unfortunate requirement of readthedocs to autogenerate the sidebar list of all the pages as specified in the `index.rst`. I've changed them to increase by a depth of 1 for every layer deeper they go. 
- Changed every HIPE's `<h1>` title to be the HIPE number and name in the following way: `0025-indy-docs-framework --> 0025: Indy Docs Framework`
- Minor punctuation edits found during the review of the hipes.

Thanks for taking the time to review! I'm happy to make more or less adjustments based on feedback.

title: Proposed HIPE: Change the HIPE process to not be PR-centric
body: This is a proposed HIPE to change from the current PR-based HIPE incubation process to one based on merged PRs in different folders based on the status of the HIPE. Challenges with the existing process are presented and a HIPE life-cycle process is proposed.

title: New HIPE consent receipt
body:
Hi,
I have created a new HIPE on the topic of consent receipt. There has been a lot of discussion on the subject and this is an initial proposal to help document what is needed to be supported in Indy and how it will work practice with use cases. Hope the draft is clear but if any further clarification that is needed before being accepted let me know. Eventually a sequence diagram and demo will be created to further support the draft.
Thanks,
Jan Lindquist

title: Update Message Type HIPE to include guidelines
FCP HIPE: support multiple key types
Wallet Storage Plug-in - Postgres Lessons Learned, Outstanding Issues
body:
This HIPE describes a common set of tools and framework for developing wallet storage plug-ins, including:

- Standard rust software components to facilitate building new plug-ins (in rust)
- Standard test suite for verifying correct implementation of the plug-in
- Standard interfaces and constants exposed from the Indy-sdk shared library

A Postgres plug-in has been developed to illustrate the proposed framework, and to be used to facilitate discussion of how the above points will be implemented.  The initial codebase for the Postgres plug-in is available in PR https://github.com/hyperledger/indy-sdk/pull/1238.

FCP HIPE: Wire Messages (formerly AMES)
body:
This is the JWM work, but it's been renamed to prevent confusion. I'm expecting it to diverge further from the JWE spec some more in order to align with other multiplex designs. It details the format of the serialization and the API that should be used to use this functionality. I expect there to be some discussion and changes in relation to multiplexing described [here](https://github.com/sovrin-foundation/protocol/blob/master/janus/message-packaging.md#multiplexing-authcrypt-messages)

[rendered text](https://github.com/kdenhartog/indy-hipe/tree/AMES/text/0028-wire-message-format)

title: approved HIPE: Maintainer Procedures
body:
This documents the best practices used for maintaining Hyperledger
Indy Projects and details procedure for contributing to Hyperledger
Indy source code and adding new maintainers. This HIPE includes a
standard to incorporate CODING-CONVENTIONS markdown file in every
project, outlining coding best practices. As well as a MAINTAINERS
markdown file outlining maintainers and contributors.

Signed-off-by: Adam Burdett <burdettadam@gmail.com>

title: Initial rough draft of an Agent2Agent Transport Layer HIPE
body:
Signed-off-by: Stephen Curran <swcurran@gmail.com>

A first cut of the Transport Layer HIPE to get the conversation started. It's a surprisingly simple set of messages - just two.  As such, it is probably too simple and I'm missing a lot. Regardless, I hope it will get the conversation going.  The document is desperately needing some pictures, but I wanted to get this out to the community for discussion.

Hack away!
